reg_info.act_under: Opticianry Act, 1991   Loi de 1991 sur les opticiens

content.content: 1. (1) The Council shall conduct or cause to be conducted examinations for registration candidates at least once a year, and shall fix the time and place of the examinations.  O. Reg. 713/93, s. 1 (1). (2) The examinations each year shall consist of a maximum of ten sections.  O. Reg. 713/93, s. 1 (2). (3) No examination question shall be submitted to a candidate for examination until it has been approved by the Council.  O. Reg. 713/93, s. 1 (3).
content.raw_html:
1. (1) The Council shall conduct or cause to be conducted examinations for registration candidates at least once a year, and shall fix the time and place of the examinations.  O. Reg. 713/93, s. 1 (1).

(2) The examinations each year shall consist of a maximum of ten sections.  O. Reg. 713/93, s. 1 (2).

(3) No examination question shall be submitted to a candidate for examination until it has been approved by the Council.  O. Reg. 713/93, s. 1 (3).

content.content: 2. A person may apply to take the Council’s examinations by submitting an application to the Registrar in the form supplied by the Council and paying the required fee.  O. Reg. 713/93, s. 2; O. Reg. 480/99, s. 1.
content.raw_html: 2. A person may apply to take the Council’s examinations by submitting an application to the Registrar in the form supplied by the Council and paying the required fee.  O. Reg. 713/93, s. 2; O. Reg. 480/99, s. 1.

content.content: 3. It is a requirement for eligibility to take the Council’s examinations that, (a) the applicant must be a registered intern optician who has completed at least 1,000 hours of verified dispensing experience; or (b) the applicant must be a person who has been ordered to take and pass the Council’s examinations by the Registration Committee as a condition of being registered as a registered optician.  O. Reg. 713/93, s. 3.
content.raw_html:
3. It is a requirement for eligibility to take the Council’s examinations that,

(a) the applicant must be a registered intern optician who has completed at least 1,000 hours of verified dispensing experience; or

(b) the applicant must be a person who has been ordered to take and pass the Council’s examinations by the Registration Committee as a condition of being registered as a registered optician.  O. Reg. 713/93, s. 3.

content.content: 4. A candidate for examination who has taken the Council’s examinations and who wishes to have his or her results reviewed by the Registration Committee is entitled to such a review upon payment of the required examination review fee.  O. Reg. 713/93, s. 4; O. Reg. 480/99, s. 2.
content.raw_html: 4. A candidate for examination who has taken the Council’s examinations and who wishes to have his or her results reviewed by the Registration Committee is entitled to such a review upon payment of the required examination review fee.  O. Reg. 713/93, s. 4; O. Reg. 480/99, s. 2.

content.content: 5. (1) A candidate who fails one or more sections of the examination shall be entitled to no more than two supplemental attempts to pass each of the sections failed.  O. Reg. 713/93, s. 5 (1). (2) Further supplemental attempts will require proof of remediation and upgrading in accordance with policy guidelines issued by the Registration Committee.  O. Reg. 713/93, s. 5 (2).
content.raw_html:
5. (1) A candidate who fails one or more sections of the examination shall be entitled to no more than two supplemental attempts to pass each of the sections failed.  O. Reg. 713/93, s. 5 (1).

(2) Further supplemental attempts will require proof of remediation and upgrading in accordance with policy guidelines issued by the Registration Committee.  O. Reg. 713/93, s. 5 (2).

content.content: 6. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation).  O. Reg. 713/93, s. 6.
content.raw_html: 6. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation).  O. Reg. 713/93, s. 6.
